20110102050009.000|20110102050010.000|TR0|SOLEDAD O'BRIEN, CNN ANCHOR:  
20110102050010.000|20110102050012.000|TR0|(voice-over):  For two years, the bodies 
20110102050012.000|20110102050013.000|TR0|of black children had been found in the 
20110102050013.000|20110102050014.000|TR0|woods, then the rivers of Atlanta, 
20110102050014.000|20110102050015.000|TR0|Georgia, in all, more than two dozen 
20110102050015.000|20110102050017.000|TR0|victims, most of them strangled.
20110102050017.000|20110102050018.000|TR0|
20110102050018.000|20110102050019.000|TR0|By May 1981, the police and FBI were 
20110102050019.000|20110102050020.000|TR0|hiding in the brush beside and below the 
20110102050020.000|20110102050022.000|TR0|river bridges.  This was to be the last 
20110102050022.000|20110102050023.000|TR0|night, almost the last hour.
20110102050023.000|20110102050024.000|TR0|
20110102050024.000|20110102050025.000|TR0|BOB CAMPBELL, POLICE RECRUIT:  I heard the 
20110102050025.000|20110102050027.000|TR0|-- heard the splash.
20110102050027.000|20110102050028.000|TR0|
20110102050028.000|20110102050029.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  Bob Campbell, a police recruit, 
20110102050029.000|20110102050030.000|TR0|jumped to his feet down beside the 
20110102050030.000|20110102050032.000|TR0|Chattahoochee River.
20110102050032.000|20110102050033.000|TR0|
20110102050033.000|20110102050034.000|TR0|CAMPBELL:  I was really startled.  It 
20110102050034.000|20110102050035.000|TR0|sounded like a body entering the water.
20110102050035.000|20110102050037.000|TR0|
20110102050037.000|20110102050038.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  He looked up at the bridge.
20110102050038.000|20110102050039.000|TR0|
20110102050039.000|20110102050040.000|TR0|CAMPBELL:  And I saw brake lights of a car 
20110102050040.000|20110102050042.000|TR0|coming.  I saw red lights. The car started 
20110102050042.000|20110102050043.000|TR0|slowly moving away from me across the 
20110102050043.000|20110102050044.000|TR0|bridge.
20110102050044.000|20110102050045.000|TR0|
20110102050045.000|20110102050047.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  Campbell radioed the other team 
20110102050047.000|20110102050048.000|TR0|members up above him.
20110102050048.000|20110102050049.000|TR0|
20110102050049.000|20110102050050.000|TR0|CAMPBELL:  I asked, did a car stop on the 
20110102050050.000|20110102050052.000|TR0|bridge?  Because I couldn't believe what I 
20110102050052.000|20110102050053.000|TR0|saw.  And each person told me they didn't 
20110102050053.000|20110102050054.000|TR0|see it.
20110102050054.000|20110102050055.000|TR0|

20110102050057.000|20110102050058.000|TR0|hidden on the other side came on the radio.
20110102050058.000|20110102050059.000|TR0|
20110102050059.000|20110102050100.000|TR0|CAMPBELL:  He just said, the car is 
20110102050100.000|20110102050102.000|TR0|pulling in the parking lot here, turning

20110102050105.000|20110102050107.000|TR0|

20110102050108.000|20110102050109.000|TR0|wagon.  Police followed it and stopped it 
20110102050109.000|20110102050110.000|TR0|nearby.  FBI agent Mike McComas (ph) 
20110102050110.000|20110102050112.000|TR0|rushed to the scene. The driver was 
20110102050112.000|20110102050113.000|TR0|standing by the highway.
20110102050113.000|20110102050114.000|TR0|
20110102050114.000|20110102050115.000|TR0|MIKE MCCOMAS (ph), FBI AGENT:  was talking 
20110102050115.000|20110102050117.000|TR0|with the officers.  Saw a black male.  He 
20110102050117.000|20110102050118.000|TR0|had on a baseball hat, had on glasses.
20110102050118.000|20110102050119.000|TR0|
20110102050119.000|20110102050120.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  The young man was Wayne 
20110102050120.000|20110102050122.000|TR0|Williams, about to turn 23, a self- 
20110102050122.000|20110102050123.000|TR0|anointed music talent scout who slept days 
20110102050123.000|20110102050124.000|TR0|and roamed the city at night.  McComas 
20110102050124.000|20110102050125.000|TR0|invited Williams over to his car. MCCOMAS: 
20110102050125.000|20110102050127.000|TR0| He got in the car, and I said, do you 
20110102050127.000|20110102050128.000|TR0|know why we're here? And he immediately 
20110102050128.000|20110102050129.000|TR0|said, yes, it's about the missing 
20110102050129.000|20110102050130.000|TR0|children.  And that kind of stunned me.  
20110102050130.000|20110102050132.000|TR0|And I said, well, what do you know about 
20110102050132.000|20110102050133.000|TR0|that?  He goes, well, I don't think that 
20110102050133.000|20110102050134.000|TR0|the various news agencies are covering it 
20110102050134.000|20110102050135.000|TR0|adequately.  Do you?
20110102050135.000|20110102050137.000|TR0|
20110102050137.000|20110102050138.000|TR0|Two weeks later, this headline would break 
20110102050138.000|20110102050139.000|TR0|the news of that night on the bridge.  
20110102050139.000|20110102050140.000|TR0|Wayne Williams would be sent to prison to 
20110102050140.000|20110102050142.000|TR0|serve two life sentences for murder.
20110102050142.000|20110102050143.000|TR0|
20110102050143.000|20110102050144.000|TR0|At first glance, he hardly looks like a 
20110102050144.000|20110102050145.000|TR0|serial killer, not much more than 5.5 feet 
20110102050145.000|20110102050147.000|TR0|tall, barely 150 pounds, now in his 50s 
20110102050147.000|20110102050148.000|TR0|and growing bald.
20110102050148.000|20110102050149.000|TR0|
20110102050149.000|20110102050150.000|TR0|WAYNE WILLIAMS, CONVICTED MURDERER:  The 
20110102050150.000|20110102050152.000|TR0|bottom line is, nobody ever testified or 
20110102050152.000|20110102050153.000|TR0|even claimed that they saw me strike 
20110102050153.000|20110102050154.000|TR0|another person, choke another person, 
20110102050154.000|20110102050156.000|TR0|stab, beat or kill or hurt anybody, 
20110102050156.000|20110102050157.000|TR0|because I didn't.
20110102050157.000|20110102050158.000|TR0|

20110102050159.000|20110102050201.000|TR0|Williams has talked on TV in at least a 
20110102050201.000|20110102050202.000|TR0|decade.

20110102050208.000|20110102050209.000|TR0|
20110102050209.000|20110102050211.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  What do you mean?
20110102050211.000|20110102050212.000|TR0|
20110102050212.000|20110102050213.000|TR0|WILLIAMS:  Atlanta at the time was in a 
20110102050213.000|20110102050214.000|TR0|panic.  They wanted any suspect that they 
20110102050214.000|20110102050216.000|TR0|could find.  And let's just be honest.  It 
20110102050216.000|20110102050217.000|TR0|had to be a black person, because, if it 
20110102050217.000|20110102050218.000|TR0|had been a white suspect, Atlanta probably 
20110102050218.000|20110102050219.000|TR0|would have gone up in flames.  It came 
20110102050219.000|20110102050221.000|TR0|very close to that.
20110102050221.000|20110102050222.000|TR0|

20110102050223.000|20110102050224.000|TR0|free?

20110102050227.000|20110102050228.000|TR0|if to me.  It's a matter of when.
20110102050228.000|20110102050229.000|TR0|
20110102050229.000|20110102050231.000|TR0|O'BRIEN (on camera):  Some 30 years after 
20110102050231.000|20110102050232.000|TR0|Wayne Williams' trial and conviction,

20110102050233.000|20110102050234.000|TR0|This time, you can be the judge and the

20110102050236.000|20110102050237.000|TR0|both sides, and you will hear from Wayne

20110102050238.000|20110102050239.000|TR0|

20110102050241.000|20110102050242.000|TR0|CNN.com, guilty, innocent, or a third 
20110102050242.000|20110102050243.000|TR0|choice, not proven.
20110102050243.000|20110102050244.000|TR0|
20110102050244.000|20110102050246.000|TR0|(voice-over):  The first clue was found on 
20110102050246.000|20110102050247.000|TR0|a dead boy's tennis shoes. The victim was 
20110102050247.000|20110102050248.000|TR0|Eric Middlebrooks, his body left here in a 
20110102050248.000|20110102050249.000|TR0|rainy alley, a foster child who rode his 
20110102050249.000|20110102050251.000|TR0|bicycle away one night on an errand, and 
20110102050251.000|20110102050252.000|TR0|was dead by dawn.
20110102050252.000|20110102050253.000|TR0|
20110102050253.000|20110102050254.000|TR0|Detective Bob Buffington saw something red 
20110102050254.000|20110102050256.000|TR0|stuck to Eric's tennis shoe.
20110102050256.000|20110102050257.000|TR0|
20110102050257.000|20110102050258.000|TR0|BOB BUFFINGTON, DETECTIVE:  And I noticed 
20110102050258.000|20110102050259.000|TR0|in the flap of the edge of this shoe this 
20110102050259.000|20110102050301.000|TR0|tuft of what to me appeared to be wool.  
20110102050301.000|20110102050302.000|TR0|And that was it.  We could find no other 
20110102050302.000|20110102050303.000|TR0|evidence.
20110102050303.000|20110102050304.000|TR0|
20110102050304.000|20110102050306.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  Back at homicide, Buffington 
20110102050306.000|20110102050307.000|TR0|showed the fibers to his superiors.
20110102050307.000|20110102050308.000|TR0|
20110102050308.000|20110102050309.000|TR0|BUFFINGTON:  The lieutenant made a big 
20110102050309.000|20110102050311.000|TR0|joke out of it and told the rest of the 
20110102050311.000|20110102050312.000|TR0|squad that, if I went over to the

20110102050314.000|20110102050316.000|TR0|clean all -- clear out all the cases in

20110102050319.000|20110102050321.000|TR0|fibers to the state crime laboratory.
20110102050321.000|20110102050322.000|TR0|
20110102050322.000|20110102050323.000|TR0|A young forensic scientist, Larry 
20110102050323.000|20110102050324.000|TR0|Peterson, took a look.
20110102050324.000|20110102050326.000|TR0|
20110102050326.000|20110102050327.000|TR0|(on camera):  So, why was a fiber stuck in 
20110102050327.000|20110102050328.000|TR0|the crack of a shoe, why was that 
20110102050328.000|20110102050329.000|TR0|important?
20110102050329.000|20110102050331.000|TR0|
20110102050331.000|20110102050332.000|TR0|LARRY PETERSON, FORENSIC SCIENTIST:  
20110102050332.000|20110102050333.000|TR0|Because it was somewhat loosely there.  
20110102050333.000|20110102050334.000|TR0|And people normally don't have tufts of 
20110102050334.000|20110102050336.000|TR0|carpet fibers loosely stuck in their shoe.
20110102050336.000|20110102050337.000|TR0|
20110102050337.000|20110102050338.000|TR0|O'BRIEN (voice-over):  From those few thin 
20110102050338.000|20110102050339.000|TR0|threads, Peterson would begin to build a 
20110102050339.000|20110102050341.000|TR0|case to try to catch a killer.
20110102050341.000|20110102050342.000|TR0|
20110102050342.000|20110102050343.000|TR0|(on camera):  How many fibers across the

20110102050345.000|20110102050346.000|TR0|case, when the case really started getting 
20110102050346.000|20110102050347.000|TR0|busy, 100, 500, 1,000?
20110102050347.000|20110102050348.000|TR0|
20110102050348.000|20110102050350.000|TR0|PETERSON:  Well, literally, there's going 
20110102050350.000|20110102050351.000|TR0|to be hundreds, if not thousands, of 
20110102050351.000|20110102050352.000|TR0|fibers there, depending upon the case.
20110102050352.000|20110102050353.000|TR0|
20110102050353.000|20110102050355.000|TR0|O'BRIEN (voice-over):  In the spring of 
20110102050355.000|20110102050356.000|TR0|1980, no one wanted to believe a serial 
20110102050356.000|20110102050357.000|TR0|killer was loose in the city, even when 
20110102050357.000|20110102050358.000|TR0|Bob Buffington spotted a disturbing 
20110102050358.000|20110102050400.000|TR0|pattern.
20110102050400.000|20110102050401.000|TR0|
20110102050401.000|20110102050402.000|TR0|BUFFINGTON:  There had been a sharp

20110102050405.000|20110102050406.000|TR0|

20110102050407.000|20110102050408.000|TR0|homicide, the major threatened to transfer 
20110102050408.000|20110102050410.000|TR0|him.
20110102050410.000|20110102050411.000|TR0|
20110102050411.000|20110102050412.000|TR0|BUFFINGTON:  And I truly think that they 
20110102050412.000|20110102050413.000|TR0|were afraid that there would be a panic.
20110102050413.000|20110102050415.000|TR0|
20110102050415.000|20110102050416.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  It was this mother, after the 
20110102050416.000|20110102050417.000|TR0|loss of her 9-year-old son, who finally 
20110102050417.000|20110102050418.000|TR0|forced police to listen, but not until 
20110102050418.000|20110102050420.000|TR0|almost a year after her boy died.
20110102050420.000|20110102050421.000|TR0|
20110102050421.000|20110102050422.000|TR0|Camille Bell and her children lived in 
20110102050422.000|20110102050423.000|TR0|these project apartments, poor to the eye, 
20110102050423.000|20110102050425.000|TR0|but rich in mind and spirit.  Yusef Bell 
20110102050425.000|20110102050426.000|TR0|was an honor student in the gifted program 
20110102050426.000|20110102050427.000|TR0|at school.  On a warm October Sunday in 
20110102050427.000|20110102050428.000|TR0|1979, he walked away on an errand to buy 
20110102050428.000|20110102050430.000|TR0|snuff for an elderly lady downstairs.
20110102050430.000|20110102050431.000|TR0|
20110102050431.000|20110102050432.000|TR0|CAMILLE BELL, MOTHER OF MURDER VICTIM:  He 
20110102050432.000|20110102050433.000|TR0|went barefooted in a pair of Brown shorts. 
20110102050433.000|20110102050435.000|TR0| He got to the store.  He bought the 
20110102050435.000|20110102050436.000|TR0|snuff.  He started back home.
20110102050436.000|20110102050437.000|TR0|
20110102050437.000|20110102050438.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  Less than half-a-block from this 
20110102050438.000|20110102050440.000|TR0|store, Yusef Bell stepped off this curb 
20110102050440.000|20110102050441.000|TR0|and vanished.
20110102050441.000|20110102050442.000|TR0|
20110102050442.000|20110102050443.000|TR0|BELL:  And nobody saw anybody do anything 
20110102050443.000|20110102050445.000|TR0|or anything.  But they did see him come 
20110102050445.000|20110102050446.000|TR0|back across the street.  And that's the 
20110102050446.000|20110102050447.000|TR0|last that we saw him.
20110102050447.000|20110102050448.000|TR0|
20110102050448.000|20110102050450.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  Camille Bell called the police.  
20110102050450.000|20110102050451.000|TR0|They came and said they would write a 
20110102050451.000|20110102050452.000|TR0|report.  That's all.  Days went by.  
20110102050452.000|20110102050453.000|TR0|Camille waited with two older children and 
20110102050453.000|20110102050455.000|TR0|Yusef's 3-year-old sister.
20110102050455.000|20110102050456.000|TR0|
20110102050456.000|20110102050457.000|TR0|BELL:  And so she is terrified.  If he can 
20110102050457.000|20110102050458.000|TR0|go to the store and they can steal him, 
20110102050458.000|20110102050500.000|TR0|then she doesn't want to leave the house.  
20110102050500.000|20110102050501.000|TR0|She doesn't want to do anything.
20110102050501.000|20110102050502.000|TR0|
20110102050502.000|20110102050503.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  Camille hid her own fear from 
20110102050503.000|20110102050505.000|TR0|her children.
20110102050505.000|20110102050506.000|TR0|
20110102050506.000|20110102050507.000|TR0|BELL:  And you have got to hold them 
20110102050507.000|20110102050508.000|TR0|together, so you can't act as scared as 
20110102050508.000|20110102050510.000|TR0|you are.
20110102050510.000|20110102050511.000|TR0|

20110102050512.000|20110102050513.000|TR0|Yusef Bell was found in an abandoned 
20110102050513.000|20110102050515.000|TR0|schoolhouse.
20110102050515.000|20110102050516.000|TR0|
20110102050516.000|20110102050517.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  His body would not turn up for 
20110102050517.000|20110102050518.000|TR0|another month.  Yusef Bell had been 
20110102050518.000|20110102050520.000|TR0|strangled.
20110102050520.000|20110102050521.000|TR0|
20110102050521.000|20110102050522.000|TR0|BELL:  All of the what could have been, 
20110102050522.000|20110102050523.000|TR0|should have been and probably would have 
20110102050523.000|20110102050525.000|TR0|been was taken away, and we will never 
20110102050525.000|20110102050526.000|TR0|know now, because somebody decided that it 
20110102050526.000|20110102050527.000|TR0|was all right to just kill a little kid 
20110102050527.000|20110102050528.000|TR0|because they wanted to.
20110102050528.000|20110102050530.000|TR0|
20110102050530.000|20110102050531.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  For a long time, the 3-year-old 
20110102050531.000|20110102050532.000|TR0|would look for Yusef every time it was a 
20110102050532.000|20110102050534.000|TR0|foggy day.
20110102050534.000|20110102050535.000|TR0|
20110102050535.000|20110102050536.000|TR0|BELL:  And we would go out into the fog, 
20110102050536.000|20110102050537.000|TR0|and she would go as far as she could into 
20110102050537.000|20110102050539.000|TR0|the fog.  And I would say, come back here. 
20110102050539.000|20110102050540.000|TR0| And she would say, I got to go find my 
20110102050540.000|20110102050541.000|TR0|brother.  And she said, the clouds came

20110102050545.000|20110102050546.000|TR0|confused the fog with heaven.

20110102050547.000|20110102050549.000|TR0|ANNOUNCER:  Still ahead: the boy who was 
20110102050549.000|20110102050550.000|TR0|too brave.
20110102050550.000|20110102050551.000|TR0|

20110102050552.000|20110102050554.000|TR0|man, I want to find this killer and get 
20110102050554.000|20110102050555.000|TR0|this reward money.
20110102050555.000|20110102050556.000|TR0|

20110102050739.000|20110102050740.000|TR0|police:  Deaths of blacks draw less

20110102050749.000|20110102050750.000|TR0|especially the black and poor and Southern.

20110102050755.000|20110102050756.000|TR0|home, unlike most murder victims, who are

20110102050853.000|20110102050854.000|TR0|dozen years since the murder of Dr. Martin 
20110102050854.000|20110102050855.000|TR0|Luther King.  On the surface, Atlanta was

20110102050903.000|20110102050904.000|TR0|reason why you wanted him to be black, I

20110102050920.000|20110102050922.000|TR0|Angeles, each time the accused serial 
20110102050922.000|20110102050923.000|TR0|killer turned out to be African-American.

20110102051122.000|20110102051123.000|TR0|O'BRIEN (voice-over):  So many of the 
20110102051123.000|20110102051124.000|TR0|children who died were poor, who earned 
20110102051124.000|20110102051126.000|TR0|spending money carrying groceries, running 
20110102051126.000|20110102051127.000|TR0|errands for others, or, like Lubie Geter, 
20110102051127.000|20110102051128.000|TR0|peddling car deodorizers outside this 
20110102051128.000|20110102051129.000|TR0|supermarket on New Year's weekend, 1981.  
20110102051129.000|20110102051131.000|TR0|His mother worried about him going off 
20110102051131.000|20110102051132.000|TR0|alone.
20110102051132.000|20110102051133.000|TR0|
20110102051133.000|20110102051134.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE:  He said he was a big 
20110102051134.000|20110102051136.000|TR0|boy, that they had to catch him first.

20110102051137.000|20110102051138.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  Lubie was a good student, a 
20110102051138.000|20110102051139.000|TR0|sophomore in high school.  A witness at

20110102051142.000|20110102051143.000|TR0|this sketch, a man with a baseball cap, 
20110102051143.000|20110102051144.000|TR0|perhaps a scar on his cheek.  Lubie never 
20110102051144.000|20110102051146.000|TR0|came home.
20110102051146.000|20110102051147.000|TR0|
20110102051147.000|20110102051148.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE:  I believe he had 
20110102051148.000|20110102051149.000|TR0|been kidnapped.
20110102051149.000|20110102051151.000|TR0|
20110102051151.000|20110102051152.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  Police searched the woods around

20110102052255.000|20110102052256.000|TR0|involved in the Ku Klux Klan could be 
20110102052256.000|20110102052257.000|TR0|Atlanta's serial killer.
20110102052257.000|20110102052258.000|TR0|
20110102052258.000|20110102052300.000|TR0|BOB INGRAM, GBI:  Atlanta was about to 
20110102052300.000|20110102052301.000|TR0|explode, and here was information 
20110102052301.000|20110102052302.000|TR0|potentially that the Klan could have been 
20110102052302.000|20110102052303.000|TR0|doing this.
20110102052303.000|20110102052305.000|TR0|

20110102052306.000|20110102052307.000|TR0|Georgia's Bureau of Investigation, got the 
20110102052307.000|20110102052308.000|TR0|case.
20110102052308.000|20110102052310.000|TR0|
20110102052310.000|20110102052311.000|TR0|INGRAM:  It was an entire family of 
20110102052311.000|20110102052312.000|TR0|brothers that were involved in the Klan 
20110102052312.000|20110102052313.000|TR0|that were the focus of this particular 
20110102052313.000|20110102052315.000|TR0|intelligence information.
20110102052315.000|20110102052316.000|TR0|
20110102052316.000|20110102052317.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  An informant said one brother 
20110102052317.000|20110102052318.000|TR0|had threatened Lubie Geter, the child 
20110102052318.000|20110102052320.000|TR0|found dead only weeks before.  The Klan 
20110102052320.000|20110102052321.000|TR0|associate lived here on a dead-end street 
20110102052321.000|20110102052322.000|TR0|in the railroad town of Mountain View on 
20110102052322.000|20110102052323.000|TR0|the outskirts of Atlanta.
20110102052323.000|20110102052325.000|TR0|
20110102052325.000|20110102052326.000|TR0|INGRAM:  We're tapping telephones.  We 
20110102052326.000|20110102052327.000|TR0|heard a lot of rhetoric.  We heard a lot 
20110102052327.000|20110102052328.000|TR0|of racial slurs.
20110102052328.000|20110102052330.000|TR0|
20110102052330.000|20110102052331.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  On one wiretap, the detectives 
20110102052331.000|20110102052332.000|TR0|heard this said.  "Go find you another 
20110102052332.000|20110102052333.000|TR0|little kid?" The GBI followed the four 
20110102052333.000|20110102052335.000|TR0|brothers for almost two months.
20110102052335.000|20110102052336.000|TR0|
20110102052336.000|20110102052337.000|TR0|INGRAM:  These family members were under 
20110102052337.000|20110102052339.000|TR0|surveillance at that time, physical 
20110102052339.000|20110102052340.000|TR0|surveillance where we had an eyeball on 
20110102052340.000|20110102052341.000|TR0|them.
20110102052341.000|20110102052342.000|TR0|
20110102052342.000|20110102052344.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  In those two months, six more 
20110102052344.000|20110102052345.000|TR0|black youths would disappear and die.  
20110102052345.000|20110102052346.000|TR0|Detectives saw nothing to link the Klan to 
20110102052346.000|20110102052347.000|TR0|them.
20110102052347.000|20110102052349.000|TR0|
20110102052349.000|20110102052350.000|TR0|BOB BUFFINGTON, HOMICIDE DETECTIVE:  If 
20110102052350.000|20110102052351.000|TR0|somebody was in there with a van or two or 
20110102052351.000|20110102052352.000|TR0|three men who -- you know, to grab 
20110102052352.000|20110102052354.000|TR0|somebody and dump them in the back of the 
20110102052354.000|20110102052355.000|TR0|van, people would have noticed if they 
20110102052355.000|20110102052356.000|TR0|were white.
20110102052356.000|20110102052357.000|TR0|

20110102053543.000|20110102053544.000|TR0|certain times of the day and night.  Some 
20110102053544.000|20110102053545.000|TR0|of them don't have no kind of home 
20110102053545.000|20110102053546.000|TR0|supervision.  They're just running around 
20110102053546.000|20110102053548.000|TR0|in the streets wild.  I'm saying when 
20110102053548.000|20110102053549.000|TR0|you're doing that, that's not giving 
20110102053549.000|20110102053550.000|TR0|anybody a license to kill but you're 
20110102053550.000|20110102053551.000|TR0|opening yourself up for all kinds of 
20110102053551.000|20110102053553.000|TR0|things.
20110102053553.000|20110102053554.000|TR0|
20110102053554.000|20110102053555.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  We asked Wayne what he meant.  
20110102053555.000|20110102053556.000|TR0|When you say that's not giving anybody a 
20110102053556.000|20110102053558.000|TR0|license to kill but you're opening 
20110102053558.000|20110102053559.000|TR0|yourself up for all kinds of things --
20110102053559.000|20110102053600.000|TR0|
20110102053600.000|20110102053601.000|TR0|WILLIAMS:  My point is very simple.  All 
20110102053601.000|20110102053603.000|TR0|right.  If you're out roaming the streets 
20110102053603.000|20110102053604.000|TR0|like -- not all of these but some of these 
20110102053604.000|20110102053605.000|TR0|victims were -- you put yourself in a 
20110102053605.000|20110102053606.000|TR0|position for bad things to happen.
20110102053606.000|20110102053608.000|TR0|
20110102053608.000|20110102053609.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  For days, the district attorney 
20110102053609.000|20110102053610.000|TR0|was reluctant to take Wayne Williams to 
20110102053610.000|20110102053611.000|TR0|court based on fibers alone.  While he 
20110102053611.000|20110102053613.000|TR0|hesitated, the FBI, police and media all

20110102053614.000|20110102053615.000|TR0|lot one day, he showed an angry face to a

20110102053625.000|20110102053627.000|TR0|arrive to arrest Wayne Williams for the

20110102053655.000|20110102053657.000|TR0|weapon, no apparent motive.
20110102053657.000|20110102053658.000|TR0|

20110102053700.000|20110102053702.000|TR0|CNN.com.  Three choices -- guilty,

20110102053703.000|20110102053704.000|TR0|the verdict's yours.  Mary Welcome was

20110102054107.000|20110102054108.000|TR0|and asleep in bed.  His mother and father, 
20110102054108.000|20110102054110.000|TR0|now deceased, backed him up.  Homer 
20110102054110.000|20110102054111.000|TR0|Williams said he had the white station

20110102054133.000|20110102054135.000|TR0|is this the same Wayne that was up here 
20110102054135.000|20110102054136.000|TR0|yesterday? I could see that.
20110102054136.000|20110102054137.000|TR0|
20110102054137.000|20110102054139.000|TR0|O'BRIEN:  Patrick Baltazar's stepmother 
20110102054139.000|20110102054140.000|TR0|was watching in court that day.
20110102054140.000|20110102054141.000|TR0|
20110102054141.000|20110102054142.000|TR0|UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE:  I'm like, this man 
20110102054142.000|20110102054144.000|TR0|got to be crazy.  This man -- I mean, he 
20110102054144.000|20110102054145.000|TR0|-- it's like he's saying, yeah, I killed 
20110102054145.000|20110102054146.000|TR0|them, but you better prove it.  Can you 
20110102054146.000|20110102054147.000|TR0|prove it? He was doing everything he can

20110102054215.000|20110102054216.000|TR0|of anything.  Just drop him and shoot him

20110102054217.000|20110102054219.000|TR0|words, you're useless.

20110102054721.000|20110102054722.000|TR0|12-year-old Clifford Jones, left by a

20110102054727.000|20110102054728.000|TR0|Clifford Jones.  Detective Welcome Harris

20110102054729.000|20110102054731.000|TR0|
20110102054731.000|20110102054732.000|TR0|HARRIS:  He exaggerated stuff.  He could 
20110102054732.000|20110102054733.000|TR0|-- in other words, he was open to 
20110102054733.000|20110102054734.000|TR0|suggestions.  And if you said that Mickey 
20110102054734.000|20110102054736.000|TR0|Mouse was up there and if he sensed that 
20110102054736.000|20110102054737.000|TR0|you wanted him to say that, he'd say yeah.
20110102054737.000|20110102054738.000|TR0|

20110102055156.000|20110102055157.000|TR0|Remember those two human hairs found 
20110102055157.000|20110102055159.000|TR0|inside 11-year-old Patrick Baltazar's 
20110102055159.000|20110102055200.000|TR0|shirt?  In 2007, the hair fragments were 
20110102055200.000|20110102055201.000|TR0|sent to the FBI's DNA laboratory in 
20110102055201.000|20110102055202.000|TR0|Quantico, Virginia.  The result?  The lab 
20110102055202.000|20110102055204.000|TR0|said it found this DNA sequence in only 29 
20110102055204.000|20110102055205.000|TR0|out of more than 1,100 samples of 
20110102055205.000|20110102055206.000|TR0|African-American hairs in its database, 
20110102055206.000|20110102055207.000|TR0|less than three percent.  Most important, 
20110102055207.000|20110102055209.000|TR0|Wayne Williams' DNA had the same sequence. 
20110102055209.000|20110102055210.000|TR0| .

20110102055330.000|20110102055331.000|TR0|Williams, we had one question he was not 
20110102055331.000|20110102055333.000|TR0|expecting, what Wayne had written about 
20110102055333.000|20110102055334.000|TR0|being recruited for espionage training as 
20110102055334.000|20110102055335.000|TR0|a teenager.  At a secret government camp
